title: 113_hr1098
content: The Act titled "Traumatic Brain Injury Reauthorization Act of 2014" is focused on CDC programs for the prevention and surveillance of traumatic brain injury. The Traumatic Brain Injury Reauthorization Act of 2014 amends health-status goals for 2020 and requires reports on traumatic brain injury surveillance within 24 months of enactment. The Traumatic Brain Injury Reauthorization Act of 2014 requires a report to be submitted to Congress identifying adopted and not adopted recommendations, along with planned activities to address the recommendations not adopted. Amendments are made to the Public Health Service Act regarding funding. The Traumatic Brain Injury Reauthorization Act of 2014 requires a report to be submitted to Congress identifying recommendations. An amendment to the Public Health Service Act authorizes $6,100,000 for sections 393B and 393C for fiscal years 2015 through 2019. SEC. 3. STATE GRANTS FOR PROJECTS REGARDING TRAUMATIC BRAIN INJURY. Amendments are made to the Public Health Service Act regarding traumatic brain injury grants, including authorization of appropriations for fiscal years 2015 through 2019. Section 1253 of the Public Health Service Act is amended to replace references to the Administrator with the Secretary in various subsections. Additionally, reporting requirements for protection and advocacy systems are outlined, with a report due from the Secretary within one year. The Secretary is required to submit a report to Congress within a year of the Traumatic Brain Injury Reauthorization Act of 2014 enactment, detailing services and activities under this section. Changes include replacing references to the Administrator with the Secretary in subsections and updating references to subtitle C. Subsection (l) regarding authorization of appropriations is removed. The Traumatic Brain Injury Reauthorization Act of 2014 requires the Secretary to report to Congress on services and activities within a year of enactment. Changes include updating references and removing subsection (l) on authorization of appropriations. Subsection (m) is redesignated as subsection (l). The Traumatic Brain Injury Reauthorization Act of 2014 was passed by the House of Representatives on June 24, 2014.
